elements.label: Workspace
elements.helpText:
Select a folder to be used as your workspace. If the folder you select does not exist, it will be created for you.

This folder will contain the rasters produced by this model. If datasets already exist in this folder, they will be overwritten.

elements.label: Current land cover map
elements.helpText:
This must be a raster dataset that GDAL can
                    open. Each cell should represent a LULC code as an Integer.
                    The dataset should be in a projection where the units are
                    in meters and the projection used should be defined. The
                    LULC codes must match the codes in the Sensitivity table

elements.label: Future land cover map (optional)
elements.helpText:
This input is optional but if provided must be
                    a raster dataset that GDAL can open. Each cell should 
                    represent a LULC code as an Integer.
                    The dataset should be in a projection where the units are
                    in meters and the projection used should be defined. The
                    LULC codes must match the codes in the Sensitivity table

elements.label: Baseline land cover map (optional)
elements.helpText:
This input is optional but if provided must be
                    a raster dataset that GDAL can open. Each cell should 
                    represent a LULC code as an Integer.
                    The dataset should be in a projection where the units are
                    in meters and the projection used should be defined. The
                    LULC codes must match the codes in the Sensitivity table.
                    If possible the baseline map should refer to a time when
                    intensive management of the landscape was relatively rare.

elements.label: Threats data
elements.helpText:
A CSV file of all the threats for the model to
                    consider. Each row in the table is a degradation source and
                    each column contains a different attribute of each
                    degradation source (THREAT, MAX_DIST, WEIGHT, DECAY). See
                    the user's guide for valid values for these columns.

elements.label: Accessibility to threats (optional)
elements.helpText:
This must be a polygon shapefile that OGR can
                    open. The input contains data on the relative protection
                    that legal / institutional / social / physical barriers
                    provide against threats. Should contain polygons with
                    values ranging from 0 - 1 where 1 is fully accessible. Any
                    cells not covered by a polygon will be set to 1.

elements.label: Sensitivity of land cover types to each threat
elements.helpText:
A CSV file of LULC types, whether or not they
                    are considered habitat, and, for LULC types that are
                    habitat, their specific sensitivity to each threat. Each
                    row is a LULC type with the following columns: LULC, NAME,
                    HABITAT, L_THREAT1, L_THREAT2, ... Each L_THREATN should
                    match exactly with the threat names given in the threat
                    CSV file, where the THREATN is what matches. Please see the users
                    guide for more detailed information on proper column values
                    and column names for each threat.

elements.label: Half-saturation constant
elements.helpText:
A positive Integer value that is defaulted at
                    30. This is the value of the parameter k in equation
                    (4). In general, set k to half of the highest grid cell
                    degradation value on the landscape. To perform this model
                    calibration you will have to run the model once to find the
                    highest degradation value and set k for your landscape.
                    Note that the choice of k only determines the spread and
                    central tendency of habitat quality cores.

elements.label: Results Suffix (optional)
elements.helpText:
A String that will be added to the end of the
                    output uris.
